results.title: One from the heart
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Gray Frederickson, Fred Roos and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: On their anniversary of 5 years together, Frannie (Teri Garr) walks out on Hank (Frederic Forrest). They are portrayed as unhappy, uncommunicative and finding fault with one another. Thus begins 48 hours in the lives of a recently separated couple. Both seek solace and answers in best friends Maggie (Lainie Kazan) and Moe (Harry Dean Stanton) then swiftly begin fledgling relationships with other people. Frannie with pianist and singer Ray (Raul Julia) - Hank with circus performer Leila (Nastassja Kinski). Not known for dabbling in romance or musicals, Coppola has managed to fashion a film about relationships, their deterioration, and our inability to change others with pathos and plenty of colour, music, dance and spectacle provided by the Las Vegas inspired sound stage. Songs and music by Tom Waits.

results.title: One film, three scripts
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Present day Puerto Rico is the subject of this film, but the film’s innovative format provides an unusual opportunity to study communication techniques. The same film footage is repeated three times accompanied by three distinct and doctrinaire texts. The viewer is thereby challenged to evaluate whose “faith is being propagated” and by what means.

results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Julia Spark
results.brief_description: A snippet of history from the television program “History in action”, this takes a look at the conditions and events leading to the construction of the Berlin Wall in 1961.

results.title: One designer, two designer
results.creator_credit: Phillip Adams, Alexander Stitt and Industrial Design Council of Australia
results.brief_description: This animated short film comically explores the importance of good design and the pitfalls of impractical design. It discusses the function of designers and designs, emphasising the need for the consumer to be more critical and thoroughly check each product before purchasing and the value of looking past attractive advertising slogans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip Adams, Alexander Stitt and Industrial Design Council of Australia

results.title: One day in the life of Rajko Maksim
results.brief_description: A look at a goose herd in rural Yugoslavia. From early morning Rajku Maksim gathers together the villagers’ geese until it is time to return them at dusk. A non-narrated photographic essay. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: One day in perfect health
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions and John Krish
results.brief_description: The story of the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, showing the work being done in combating tropical diseases. The film refers to the School’s early history and some of the famous scientists associated with it. To this school, and its hospital, come doctors and students from many countries to learn and study at first hand diseases such as malaria, sleeping sickness, and leprosy. The film was made for the British Central Office of Information.

results.title: One day's poison
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Donald Wilder
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the poison control centre at the Toronto Sick Children’s Hospital, using dramatised incidents to illustrate the variety and number of accidental poisoning’s among children. (Award: Toronto.)
